channel.title: Lecture Podcasts
channel.description: These are very large files (10 - 20MB) which contain the slides as well as the recorded lectures.
channel.itunes:subtitle: These are very large files (10 - 20MB) which contain the slides as well as the recorded lectures.
channel.itunes:summary: These are very large files (10 - 20MB) which contain the slides as well as the recorded lectures.

item.title: Anticonvulsants
item.description: A discussion of the treatment of status epilepticus (mainly diazepam) and idiopathic epilepsy (mainly phenobarbitone), with a brief mention of other drugs.
item.itunes:author: Paul Chambers
item.itunes:subtitle: A discussion of the treatment of status epilepticus (mainly diazepam) and idiopathic epilepsy (mainly phenobarbitone), with a brief mention of other drugs.
item.itunes:summary: A discussion of the treatment of status epilepticus (mainly diazepam) and idiopathic epilepsy (mainly phenobarbitone), with a brief mention of other drugs.

item.title: Inhalation Anaesthetic Drugs
item.description: A brief overview of the pharmacology of inhalation anaesthetics, including pharmacokinetics and the properties of the drugs which influence their administration. Fish anaesthesia is also mentioned.
item.itunes:author: Paul Chambers
item.itunes:subtitle: A brief overview of the pharmacology of inhalation anaesthetics, including pharmacokinetics and the properties of the drugs which influence their administration. Fish anaesthesia is also mentioned.
item.itunes:summary: A brief overview of the pharmacology of inhalation anaesthetics, including pharmacokinetics and the properties of the drugs which influence their administration. Fish anaesthesia is also mentioned.

item.title: Injection anaesthetics
item.description: The pharmacology of the common injectable anaesthetic drugs, with a brief mention of obsolete or nearly obsolete drugs. Common combinations and use for euthanasia are also covered.
item.itunes:author: Paul Chambers
item.itunes:subtitle: The pharmacology of the common injectable anaesthetic drugs, with a brief mention of obsolete or nearly obsolete drugs. Common combinations and use for euthanasia are also covered.
item.itunes:summary: The pharmacology of the common injectable anaesthetic drugs, with a brief mention of obsolete or nearly obsolete drugs. Common combinations and use for euthanasia are also covered.

item.title: Other Analgesics
item.description: This lecture covers drugs which are only useful for minor pain (NSAIDs) or which are more suited to use as part of a balanced analgesic mixture.
item.itunes:author: Paul Chambers
item.itunes:subtitle: This lecture covers drugs which are only useful for minor pain (NSAIDs) or which are more suited to use as part of a balanced analgesic mixture.
item.itunes:summary: This lecture covers drugs which are only useful for minor pain (NSAIDs) or which are more suited to use as part of a balanced analgesic mixture.

item.title: General anaesthetics and sedatives
item.description: A brief discussion of the pharmacology and mechanism of action of these drugs, with some guidelines on how to choose the best drug for any situation.
item.itunes:author: Paul Chambers
item.itunes:subtitle: A brief discussion of the pharmacology and mechanism of action of these drugs, with some guidelines on how to choose the best drug for any situation.
item.itunes:summary: A brief discussion of the pharmacology and mechanism of action of these drugs, with some guidelines on how to choose the best drug for any situation.
